comments:
I'm testing the new layout of eclipse workbench
(https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=37997) on GTK, Suse 9.0.

When I click at the button at the right side of the file name opened, I get the
error:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Fev 18, 2004 15:32:33.557
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

emersonc@elbassan:~/eclipse> kedit Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Widget is disposed

I do not see this in the February 17th integration build.  Is this the build 
that you are using (or a newer one)?  If not then please try a newer build, as 
there have been lots of changes made in this area over the last week.

If it still happens for you then some more info is needed, such as:
- how many editors are open at the time?
- are they on one shared tab, or each on a separate tab?
- what kind(s) of file(s) are open?
- does it happen in a particular perspective?
- other relevant info?

Thanks!
*** Bug 52914 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug 52914 indicates that this problem may exist on other platforms (WinXP is 
noted).
This might be related to the "Use multiple editor tabs" preference.

Steps to reproduce:
- open an editor
- press CTRL+Tab to give focus to its tab
- press Shift+F10 to show its menu
- press Esc to dismiss the menu, focus reverts to the StyledText
- press CTRL+Tab to give focus to its tab
- press Shift+F10 to show its menu   <-- exception
*** Bug 53088 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
